Package networking

Class Server

java.lang.Object
networking.Server
public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
The server class starts and opens a server on a specified port, then allows 2 incoming connections from clients, which represent players. The host starts the server and then can share the IP to players who wish to connect.

All game logic is handled on the server, which is in charge of running the current game, and the host may select a game mode or close the server as they wish.

    Starts server.

    Starts selected game mode with player 1 and player 2 once both players have connected.

    Prompts user to select game mode or exit the game.

    • Server

      public Server​(int serverPort)

  • Method Details

    • startServer

      public void startServer() throws java.io.IOException
      Starts server and opens port for incoming connections.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when server cannot be hosted on given port

    • acceptConnections

      public void acceptConnections​(java.net.ServerSocket server) throws java.io.IOException
      Accepts client connections to server and adds client socket to socketList.
      Parameters:
      server - the server accepting connections
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when server cannot accept client connection

    • setupPlayers

      public void setupPlayers() throws java.io.IOException
      Set up client input and output streams and usernames for players 1 and 2.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when inputs and outputs for players 1 and 2 cannot be set

    • promptForGameMode

      public void promptForGameMode() throws java.io.IOException
      Prompts user to select game mode or exit the game.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when input from server cannot be read

    • play

      public void play()
      Starts selected game mode with player 1 and player 2 once both players have connected.

      Game logic is handled on the server.

    • getPublicIP

      public static java.lang.String getPublicIP() throws java.io.IOException
      Gets host IP address to share with clients looking to connect.
      Returns:
      the IP address of host
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when stream from url cannot be read

    • selectGameMode

      public void selectGameMode​(java.lang.String input)
      Selects and sets current gamemode and prints to server what game mode has been selected.
      Parameters:
      input - the selected game mode

    • startGame

      public void startGame​(Player p1, Player p2)
      Starts appropriate game given selected game mode.
      Parameters:
      p1 - player 1
      p2 - player 2

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.io.IOException
      Starts server.
      Parameters:
      args - command line arguments
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when server is unable to be started
